verse.roman:
gṛhṇan niśaṅgād atha sandadhac charān
vikṛṣya muñcan śita-bāṇa-pūgān
nighnan rathān kuñjara-vāji-pattīn
nirantaraṁ yadvad alāta-cakram

synonyms: gṛhṇan—taking; niśaṅgāt—from His quiver; atha—then; sandadhat—fixing; śarān—arrows; vikṛṣya—pulling back; muñcan—releasing; śita—sharp; bāṇa—of arrows; pūgān—floods; nighnan—striking; rathān—chariots; kuñjara—elephants; vāji—horses; pattīn—and infantrymen; nirantaram—relentlessly; yadvat—just like; alāta-cakram—a burning torch whirled around to make a circle of fire.
translation: Lord Kṛṣṇa took arrows from His quiver, fixed them on the bowstring, pulled back, and released endless torrents of sharp shafts, which struck the enemy's chariots, elephants, horses and infantrymen. The Lord shooting His arrows resembled a blazing circle of fire.
